definition.en: A reference to an entity, i.e. a class or a property, which used to describe information in the to be provided evidence for the requirement
Limitation applied to requirement(s) or to the concept(s) the requirement is about.

usage.en: An example in eProcurement, a threshold: the minimum Turnover required by the buyer to select the candidates.

definition.en: condition for evaluation or assessment.

usage.en: In general, criteria are used for comparison, filtering and selection. Criteria usually set minimum constraints (e.g. limits, intervals, thresholds, etc.) that need to be met in order to pass the required conditions or to fulfil them in a certain degree or quality. The evaluation of the fulfilment is usually supported with the provision of evidences.

definition.en: The data proving that a requirement is met or has been fulfilled.
Information about the characteristics of an expected evidence, such as the desired content, format, source, etc.
A combination of evidence types that must be satisfied all together.

usage.en: NOTE: An evidence type list is satisfied iff for all evidence types an corresponding conformant evidence is supporting the requirement having this list.

definition.en: A request for data that is proof of evidence or leads to the source of such a proof.
A source from where requirements are identified and drawn.
A condition demanded.
A value for an information concept that is supported by an Evidence
Additional parameter used to adjust the evaluation of the criterion composed of multiple sub-criteria.
The security classification assigned to an Evidence or, in general, to a content.
A classification code use to specify the machine-readability of a content.

usage.en: NOTE: this property is not needed as it is more an implementation requirement. Moreover the inheritence of DCAT already tackles the need for identifying other distributions

definition.en: A classification code to specify the layout and content expected for an evidence.
The query which which the value for the information concept can be retrieved. The query must be executed on the business data provided by the supporting evidence.
The value for the information concept that the evidence is supporting.
Relative importance assigned to a given criterion.
The explanation of how the weighting of a Criterion is to be used at evaluation time.
The numeric form used to weight.
A collection of data
An entity that does things (does stuff)
the information concept which a Constaint expresses a limitation about
the requirement concept for which the requirement expects an support in the supporting evidence
A combination of types of evidences of which one of them must be satisfied by the response to the requirement

usage.en: Note: The name/label of this property is not intuitive. Suggestion: Expected Evidence Type.  To satisfy this combination one of the Evidence Type lists must be satisfied: this is thus an OR condition

definition.en: a related requirement
the kind of evidences that the requirement expects
The agent that is the main actor in the provided evidence
A reference to one or more types of evidence where the content and, possibly, the layout or configuration of the evidence is specified.

usage.en: NOTE: this property can be fullfilled with the dcat property dct:conformsTo. The definition should be reflect the need for another property. And the usagenote should make the distinction clear.

definition.en: the reference framework that is responsible for the creation/initiation of the requirement
A reference to the parent requirement a sub-requirement is part of.

usage.en: NOTE: inverse relation from hasRequirement. If there is no hierarchy then this relationship is not needed.

definition.en: an evidence type list in which the evidence type participates
This agent that has issued the requirement

usage.en: Note: Instead of creating a new URI in the cccev domain, dct:publisher could be considered.

definition.en: The information concept it is providing a value for.
Indicates one type of evidence included in a list of evidence types.
the supported concept by the evidence

usage.en: Used to express details about the information that is provided by the evidence

definition.en: the supported requirement by the evidence

usage.en: Used to express details about the information requested by the requirement.

definition.en: the Supporting value for which an evidence has information
A short explanation about the nature, attributes, uses or any other additional information that helps clarify the understanding of the Evidence Type  being instantiated.
A short explanation about the nature, attributes, uses or any other additional information that helps clarify the understanding of the RequirementConcept being instantiated.
A short explanation about the nature, attributes, uses or any other additional information that helps clarify the understanding of the Requirement  being instantiated.
An unambiguous reference to an Evidence Type List
An unambiguous reference to RequirementConcept
An unambiguous reference
a classification of the RequirementConcept
the category or type to which the requirement belongs
A name to identify in common language the Evidence Type List
A name to identify in common language the RequirementConcept
A name to identify in common language the Requirement
